intro: Symphachne, commonly known as the false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their alternate, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically have five petals. Symphachne species are often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. They produce small, three-lobed fruits that contain one or two seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
